title: US Attorney General calls for end to cocaine sentencing disparity
description: Memos from the head of US justice department take aim at drug policies linked to high rates of Black incarceration.

title: US ‘botched’ executions reach all-time high, report finds
description: Seven of 20 attempted executions in 2022 were 'visibly problematic', research group says, but practice is in decline.

title: ‘The forgotten ones’: Rural supporters stand by Peru’s Castillo
description: Pedro Castillo's removal hit a nerve in rural heartland, where ex-president's message resonated amid years of exclusion.

title: QAnon supporter gets five years for January 6 Capitol attack
description: US construction worker accused of 'weaponising' Trump supporters during the January 6 riot faces rebuke from judge.

title: Two UN peacekeepers shot dead near Timbuktu in Mali
description: UN peacekeeping mission says four others were wounded in the attack carried out by an unidentified gunman on Friday.

title: Ukraine energy firm ends state of emergency after Russia attacks
description: Ukrainian energy use dropped more than 50 percent after the Russian attacks, power grid operator Ukrenergo said.

title: Qatar 2022: Best on-field highlights from the World Cup
description: As the World Cup reaches its finale on Sunday, here's how Al Jazeera photographers captured the tournament.

title: Renowned Mexican journalist survives shooting
description: Ciro Gomez Leyva says he was saved by his armoured vehicle after gunmen shot at him near his home in Mexico City.

title: Twitter’s suspension of journalists draws global backlash
description: Officials from France, Germany, UK, UN and EU condemned the suspensions, saying it jeopardised press freedom.

title: What’s next for the ANC and South African politics?
description: South Africa's governing party conference comes at a time President Cyril Ramaphosa is mired in a corruption scandal.

title: US lawmakers quick to unload FTX founder’s contributions
description: Legislators are donating contributions from the disgraced crypto mogul but could still be on the hook for the money.

title: Argentina fans upset by lack of World Cup finals tickets
description: Hundreds are angry at the lack of ticket availability and high black-market prices for the finals against France.

title: FIFA chief praises Qatar 2022 as ‘best World Cup ever’
description: Infantino hails 'transformative legacy' of event and spread of nations in knockout stage - with a nod also to Morocco.

title: California county considers secession to become new US state
description: San Bernandino County is set to review the long-shot proposal in response to voter frustration with state lawmakers.

title: Jordanians continue fuel protests day after ‘rioting’
description: Calls for protests come a day after riots, staged mainly by angry truck drivers in Maan, left one police officer dead.

title: Timeline: Peru’s political crisis since removal of Pedro Castillo
description: Protesters are demanding Castillo's release, dissolution of Congress and early elections in the South American nation.

title: Pakistan summons Afghan diplomat over border shelling
description: Border tensions between the South Asian neighbours have risen since the Taliban returned to power last year.

title: Brittney Griner says she will return to playing basketball
description: In first remarks since returning to the US, WNBA star thanks all who pushed for her release from Russian prison.

title: US to launch new diplomatic approach to China with ‘China House’
description: The new unit in the US Department of State aims to create 'more consistent policy' towards China, a rival global power.

title: Harvard appoints Claudine Gay as first Black president
description: Social scientist and daughter of Haitian immigrants says the university must 'engage and be of service to the world'.

title: US-France satellite to map world’s oceans, rivers, lakes
description: The satellite will help track the impacts of rising sea levels, droughts and erosion brought on by climate change.

title: Burkina Faso summons Ghana envoy over president’s claim on Wagner
description: President Nana Akufo-Addo alleged during the US-Africa Leaders Summit that Burkina Faso has hired Russian mercenaries.

title: Kosovo tribunal convicts ex-rebel leader for war crimes
description: A Kosovo court seated in the Netherlands sentences Salih Mustafa to 26 years in prison in its first war crimes verdict.

title: World Cup mural gig helps Doha artist turn hobby into lifeline
description: Filipino painter Michael Conjusta was hired by Qatari authorities to paint graffiti murals during the 2022 World Cup.

title: Huge aquarium in Berlin bursts, causing tropical fish ‘tsunami’
description: The incident at the AquaDom tourist attraction - the world's biggest cylindrical tank - injures at least two people.

title: Opposition hopes democratic ideals can return in Tunisia
description: As overseas voting begins, voter apathy is palpable and begs the question if the spirit of democracy in Tunisia is dead.

title: Mail bomb wounds Russian official in CAR – Russian news agency
description: The founder of the Russian private military company Wagner has accused France of being behind the bomb.

title: Visualising the FIFA World Cup final
description: Over the World Cup's 92-year history, 13 nations have made it to the finals, with eight being crowned champions.

title: Russia ‘massively’ attacks Ukraine in latest round of raids
description: Russia launches 60 missiles on least four cities in new attack on Ukraine's infrastructure with casualties reported.

title: Protesters block Kashmir highway after two shot dead at army camp
description: Hundreds protest at the region's main highway over killing of two men who worked as labourers at an Indian army base.

title: Europe’s prosecution of Liberian war criminals is good news
description: But meaningful justice and reconciliation cannot be achieved until Liberia starts conducting its own war crimes trials.

title: Senegalese MPs detained for assaulting pregnant lawmaker
description: The fight has worsened political tensions in Senegal that flared since the ruling party lost its comfortable majority.

title: Ukraine must investigate alleged war crimes by its forces
description: Ukraine and its allies should understand that investigating such allegations is in Kyiv’s interest.

title: India, Pakistan foreign ministers trade heated barbs on ‘terror’
description: Pakistani minister calls India's Modi 'butcher of Gujarat' after Jaishankar said Pakistan is 'epicentre of terrorism'.

title: S Africa ex-President Zuma sues Ramaphosa ahead of key party vote
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa rejects the private prosecution, says Zuma is abusing legal processes.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 296
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 296th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: More than 13,000 new JFK files released; hundreds more held back
description: Record release not expected to give major revelations about the assassination of US President John F Kennedy in 1963.

title: Italy slams ECB for hiking borrowing costs as recession looms
description: The criticism comes after the European Central Bank raised interest rates by half a percentage point.

title: Pacifist Japan unveils unprecedented $320bn military build-up
description: Unthinkable under past administrations, the rapid arming of Japan has the support of about 70 percent of voters.

title: Fara Williams: England’s once-homeless football pioneer
description: By day, Williams was playing for England. By night, she was sleeping in hostels.

title: Can Somalia overcome its history of crises?
description: President Hassan Sheikh Mohamud joins Marc Lamont Hill to discuss his country’s security and humanitarian challenges.

title: Five children among at least 10 killed in fire near France’s Lyon
description: Footage on social media shows a huge, dark cloud billowing above a residential building in Vaulx-en-Velin.

title: Libya PM admits role in Lockerbie suspect’s transfer
description: The transfer of a former intelligence explosives expert to the US has prompted anger in Libya.

title: Police officer killed in Jordan as anger over fuel prices spreads
description: Clashes broke out between police and locals in several Jordanian cities, including Maan, where the officer was killed.

title: China calls for ‘arduous efforts’ to revive economy
description: State planner's comments come after the release of worse-than-expected economic data for November.

title: Car bomb in Turkey’s Diyarbakir injures police officers
description: Two people believed to be behind the blast have been detained, authorities have said.

title: Twitter suspends journalists covering Elon Musk
description: Twitter owner accuses journalists of endangering his family as press groups condemn suspensions.

title: The US is making Africa’s hunger worse
description: The pandemic and the war show the need for strong local food supply chains to avoid disruptions. Yet the US won't learn.

title: Why Indians love World Cup football, even without India in it
description: In a country that has never played at the World Cup, passion for the sport comes alive during the event.

title: Peru judge extends ex-President Castillo’s jail time by 18 months
description: Pedro Castillo's arrest on charges of 'rebellion' and 'conspiracy' has fuelled a political crisis.

title: Apple looks beyond ‘iPhone factory’ China as dalliance sours
description: Tech giant is seeking to redirect supply chains to India and Vietnam amid fears of overdependence on China.

title: Two dead, dozens missing after landslide hits Malaysian campsite
description: The site north of the Malaysian capital was hit in the early hours of morning after torrential rain.

title: North Korea says it tested ‘high-thrust solid-fuel motor’
description: Pyongyang wants to build more solid-fuel missiles, which are more stable and can be launched with almost no warning.

title: ‘I want to go outside’: First Nauru refugees finally find freedom
description: Six men held for years after trying to get to Australia by boat look forward to starting new lives in New Zealand.
